reviews.sentence: Wonderful hotel. I just escorted a group to Paris and we stayed at Pullman Paris Bercy. From the first greeting upon arrival until checkout the service was just great. My group was so pleased with the hotel and the area we will plan to return next year. The reception personnel were so very accommodating no matter how large or small the question. Our rooms were spacious and very clean. I loved having my own expreso machine along with the daily water and soft drinks. We also loved Bercy Village nearby. Breakfast buffet was excellent and offered a wide choice ofbreakfast items. My group loved the Wi Fi in each room and it helped them stay in touch with home. Thanks so much Pullman Paris Centre Bercy. We will return.

Hotel great location not. We were here as part of a tour group and found hotel lovely and staff excellent but did not care for the downtown area. Only close shopping eating area was Bercy Village and shopping there was not good and restaurants poor. We took taxis everywhere as it was easier than the metro. We would of preferred to have been in a district that had more around within walking distance.

I would definately stay there again. The hotel is excellent and very close to a metro station. It is also close to Bercy village which is full of FB outlets and has a cinema complex. The only down side is parking tarif which was a bit too much. Other than that the hotel is excellent.

Close to Bercy Village. hotel was well located check in and check out very efficient. Kettle and hairdryer in room complimentary water and take and coffee Good location good sized room Very convenient for a variety of restaurants which were reasonably priced close to Metro. Quite pricey for breakfasts.

One of the most pleasant hotels and areas I have visited. Arrived mid afternoon and was greeted by the friendly Pullman staff who were very fluent in many languages. They checked us in quickly and we also received a free up grade to a duluxe room which included a free mini bar. The hotel room was fantastic. One of the most comfy beds I have stayed in and the best shower I have ever had with a roof shower and a normal wall shower head. Facilities included minibar TV iron and ironing board coffee maker kettle and a speaker docking station although only compatible with iPhone 4s or below. The prices of drinks and food at the hotel bar and restaurant was a bit pricey for our liking € 650 for a cola € 26 for breakfast but the hotel is of the class you would expect to pay these prices. Bercy village is a 2 minute walk away and is a must to visit. It is open from 11 am 9 pm some some lovely independent shops and some fantastic eateries. I would recommend the Burger fast food restaurant and also the Frog restaurant and bar during happy hour 5 8 Monday Friday. do not make the mistake we did by getting off the metro at the Bercy station and it is a 15 25minute walk. Get off at Cour St emilion purple line 14 as this is the stop for Bercy village and 4 minute walk to the hotel. Final tip download the Paris Metro ap on your phone if you are not familiar with Paris metro system as you can use it off line and it is really useful.

Comfy and convenient. I loved the hotel very luxurious but with lots of families staying there. The staff was absolutely wonderful very friendly and helpful. The room was probably three times the size of the average Parisian hotel room I travel to Paris twice a year so I know the typical rooms. It was very conveniently located 2 minutes from the Saint Emilion metro station line 14. it is right at Bercy Village so there are plenty of restaurants and little shops. there is multiplex cinema across the street as well. Location and staff. Bercy village is across the street. Lots of restaurants and shops. I was there a few days after Christmas 2015it was bustling. Nothing in my opinion.

Not in the center but you will like it. This Bercy area and Bercy village worth a visit. It is beautiful and quiet place. I doubt that you can sleep well if the hotel is not well structured in the downtown and in closer circles to the center you should know first from the map that in which neighborhood you want to accommodate because Paris does not know day and night. Good sleep is important in a trip and you can have it at this Pullman. The room space is fine. The floor and furniture clean. The entrance lobby bar and restaurant is nice and modern. They change the design with flowers for every event happen in the hotel. It was good management. Many Lufthansa crew come and go to this hotel as they might have a contract or something. So it can talk about quality. The design of the reception is different for staff to approach to guests and ask for their needs. Most of the time they do. If you ask for help with an address or something most of the time they help with a map or a print. Although I think for this modern reception desk like this and reply to all the customers without delay they should be trained more in my opinion. We got a room in first floors but despite my assumption it was well quite and nice. In higher floors I believe you can have a good view of seine river as well. The neighborhood is calm and safe. Take a walk in Bercy park and Bercy village if you had time. They are beautiful. The closest hop on hop off station to the hotel which would be at the end of the park near the stadium arena would be approximately 20 minutes to walk. Metro is so close and only 7 8 min. walk. For Metro make sure to get daily passes or more because it is also a good mean to visit sights with no extra charge. If wanted to buy souvenirs check the price first with some other people or shops. I experienced that in Paris you can bargain. even for taxi transportationBreakfast good and complete set. Different breads and fruits. You can hardly find taxi in front of the hotel. Make sure to ask for one before your departure to airport or train station. We had a bad experience and wasted a lot of time. Free Wifi speed is good enough. Bathroom and bathtub clean and modern. Only there were no toothpaste set which I believe they will provide upon request.

Paris Indoor tennis at the Acor Hotels Arena. A very pleasurable visit from the greeting from the reception staff at check in to the Au revoir as we left with our bags six days later for the Metro. The room was comfortable quiet very clean and everything worked although it was rather dark room 821. as it only had a small window which was mostly covered by curtains. Upon arrival the king sized double bed we had booked was in fact two singles. Once reception was alerted of this domestic staff arrived promptly to zip the singles together and remake the bed. Breakfast as we have come to expect during Pullman visits was excellent with a wide choice of hot and cold food at the buffet and ample seating for all guests. An unexpected bonus for tennis fans was the presence at breakfast and around the hotel in general of many of the worlds top tennis players competing in the nearby Acor Hotels Arena. it is not every day that one stands behind Del Potro or John Isner when loading a fruit bowl and then returns to the seat to find David Gofin or Jo Wilfred Tsonga at an adjacent table. My wife and I are both vegetarians and an improvement we would like to see at breakfast is the separation of food suitable for vegetarians from the meat and fish. The hot food was all together and the serving spoons and implements were used for vegetarian food and meat dishes not good and something that made us uncomfortable. The Pullman Hotel on the Euston Road London has a completely separate serving area for vegetarian hot food so there is no chance of contamination with serving implements that have also been used for food containing meat or fish.

Christmas Stay. Traveled around Europe in a Motorhome deciden to stay here for 2 nights for Christmas. Concierge were FANTASTIC. Parked our Motorhome safely and helped in every way we needed. Rooms were clean comfi. Buffet breakfast was great. Overall we were very happy with our stay.
nice location by Bercy village and park and cinema. Got to check in early after overnight flight. Staff super helpful. Lovely breakfasts.

Ah Paris … the City of Love. Paris is a timeless classic rich in culture exquisite cuisine invaluable art and a magnetic sense of style. Paris will never disappoint you it will lure you in like a siren ’s song and immerse you in its 20 year old wonder. Visiting the French capital will be like stepping into a dream a dream you ’l never want to wake up from. Paris is regularly ranked as one of the most visited cities in the world with millions of tourists traveling to the city every year to discover all it has to offer. Although you might come to Paris eager to climb the Eiffel Tower take a selfie next to the Arc De Triomphe tour the Louvre and Notre Dame or explore the catacombs it ’s the little things that will make you fall in love with the city. A leisurely stroll down Paris ’s beautiful cobblestone streets or an afternoon spent people watching at a café might be all you ’l ever need to hold a special place in your heart for the French capital.

No pool photo and description misleading. The lady at the check in desk was amazing. It was our daughters first birthday and she brought a small cake for her. Great start. Breakfast was also great. However we booked this hotel because there was a pool and our 4 year old enjoys swimming. There was no pool at Pullman and if we had known we would have booked a different hotel. For the price we paid we could have got something much closer to the center of Paris without a pool.

The worst bedroom ever in Paris. Dark room no window bed not comfortableNothing to do with normal Pullman experienceAt check out staff told me she was not surprized considering the room without a word of excuse.

Welcoming staff good amenities in the room and poor in room breakfast. Staff were welcoming good room and very comfortable bedding. My complain would be the in room breakfast. This was my first time and I was n’t impressed by the box. Not worth the price and room service fee at all. Pastries were dry the roll of bread was hard the hot chocolate was watery with no flavour. The fruit salad was just so so bad. The only good thing in that box were the jams and butter. I was n’t expecting a box for breakfast at all. I complained and instead of a refund was offered to have breakfast in the restaurant. When I said no I was then offered some complimentary fruits. The staff were very welcoming but lacked common customer service. This being think out of the box to make the customer happy. But aside from that my sleep was great and I really liked the bedding. My advice would be to drop the fee for in room service and improve the value of the breakfast. My breakfast was n’t worth 27 € at all.

Comfortable room. This is not my first time at teh hotel and found it better than before. The room is comfortable good bedding and light. The WiFi works fine and the staff is in general efficient and gentle. Brakfast was varied complete and well presented. The bar is a different story. One night we went for a drink and seated at one of the tables for a long time without getting service. Thinking that it may be quite late we seated at the bar and eventually got service. It was not nice to feel transparent to the waiters. Next day we did not have much time for lunch so we went to teh bar again to get something quick. We were there at teh table for more than 20 minutes and nobody came to offer service. We were transparent again to the bar staff. Not a nice feeling.

The best service. So close to Bercy Village with plenty of shops restaurants and cinema. Metro close too pretty much across the road. Not long to get to tourist attractions from hotel. Staff were exceptional. Requested a cot and they brought everything we could have neded baby bath diaper genie even a teddy bear. Very impressed. Concierge and lobby staff so helpful and spoke English really well. Large king bed rooms spacious and very clean. Bar was just lovely too. The best service I ’ve ever received when staying at a hotelNot much else other than Bercy Village to see in the area. Bercy Park was nothing to rave about.

nicest hotel lobby I have seen. We have visited this hotel in the past service has improved once again but the most amazing achievement is the renovation of the hotel lobby. In this lobby you feel welcome to do whatever you like play table tennis have a drink in the atactive bar do some computer work. Guests seem to feel at home in this lobby. The breakfast room can be busy at peak hours but staff is extremely friendly and busy.

Paris. The bar was really nice. So was the gym. I also liked the location and how easy it was to get to the subway. It was a popular neighborhood but not too crowded. I think most of the staff was friendly but some not so much. Overall it was a good stay. I am not sure I would stay there again but I liked it. The first night in Paris we stayed at an Ibis. that is a tourist class hotel. I went to the pullman because I like comfortable 4 or 5 star hotels. Usually they have bigger rooms and luxuries that I enjoy when I travel. This hotel was the same as the Ibis as far as comfort and not worth the extra that I paid. Again not a bad hotel but not what I wanted. It felt like it sacrificed comfort to be trendy. I am probably just too old for that trade off.
